No further information was specified on the charges, but the Popular Resistance group released a statement claiming that the arrest was politically motivated aiming to intimidate before the day of repudiation of the dictatorship scheduled for 1 June.

On 1 June 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of the Popular Resistance Bloc and other protesters gathered in front of the National University to protests against President Bukele's second mandate, claiming that there had been voter fraud and that his second mandate was unconstitutional.

Property destruction: On 4 June 2024, off the Coast of San Rafael Tasajera, La Paz, southwest of Bocana El Cordoncillo, members of the Salvadorean navy seized a boat with 1.3 tons of cocaine on board. They also arrested three Ecuadorean men on board the boat. There were no fatalities.

assoc_actor_1: Christian Group (El Salvador); Labor Group (El Salvador); Teachers (El Salvador); Women (El Salvador)
notes: On 5 June 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of various organizations including Christian groups, women organizations, academic, human rights organizations, and environmental organizations gathered and marched towards the Legislative Assembly to demand ecological measures and an end to the exploitation of natural resources, as well as more rights for populations and individuals engaging in environmental work.

On 9 June 2024, in Delgado, San Salvador, members of different organizations held a protest outside the headquarters of a local newspaper to protests against the arrests of several veterans of the Salvadorean civil war, who have been accused of plotting violent acts.

On 12 June 2024, in the department of La Union, La Union, Police carried out a simultaneous police operation in La Union and San Miguel (coded separately) with the objective of dismantling an MS-13 structure operating in the eastern part of the country. A total of 32 people were arrested in the two departments and 7 vehicles, several cell phones, 52 cocaine portions, 3 coin swallowing machines and $2,076.00 dollars in cash were seized..

On 12 June 2024, in the department of San Miguel, San Miguel, Police carried out a simultaneous police operation in San Miguel and La Union (coded separately) with the objective of dismantling an MS-13 structure operating in the eastern part of the country. A total of 32 people were arrested in the two departments and 7 vehicles, several cell phones, 52 cocaine portions, 3 coin swallowing machines and $2,076.00 dollars in cash were seized.

On 13 June 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, protesters gathered in front of the San Marcos local council to demand more investment in infrastructure to improve living conditions for the inhabitants of the area. Among the participants there were members of the COFOA - Communities of Faith Organized in Action (Catholic group).

Property destruction: On 22 June 2024, off the Coast of San Rafael Tasajera, La Paz, southwest of Bocana El Cordoncillo, members of the Salvadorean navy seized a boat containing two tons of cocaine, and arrested two Ecuadorean and one Colombian man.

On 25 June 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of the BRP group protested against the detention of veterans of the Salvadorean civil war, who stand accused of plotting a terrorist attack against President Bukele. The members of the BRP, who held their protests outside the El Penalito prison, where the veterans are detained, claim that the charges are politically motivated.

On 25 June 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of the Popular Resistance Bloc held a peaceful protest outside the El Penalito prison, in solidarity with the former guerrilla members accused of plotting an attack on the day of President Bukele's inauguration. The protesters claim the charges are politically motivated, and they complained about the conditions in which the detainees are kept.

On 26 June 2024, in San Miguel, San Miguel, inhabitants of the Espana neighborhood gathered to protests in front of the local district attorney's office for the continued cuts to their water supply, despite their payment of the monthly fee.

On 29 June 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, more than 1000 members of the queer community held a march to celebrate their identity and demand equal rights and an end to discrimination based on gender identity or sexual orientation, as well as standing in solidarity with other oppressed people. The protesters also denounced the setbacks suffered in terms of recognition of their rights after measures such as the dissolution of the Directorate of Sexual Diversity, repeal of the decree prohibiting discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity, exclusion from medical care, education, and the archiving of projects such as the gender identity law and the law of equality and non-discrimination. Upon arriving at the Salvador del Mundo square, the demonstrators met a group of foreigners from an evangelical church who, with banners in hand, accused the demonstrators of being sinners.

On 5 July 2024, in San Eduardo, La Union, members of the local community gathered to protest the installation of a radio antenna near a school in their village. They protested against the potential radiation coming from the antenna and suggested it should be relocated farther away from the village.

On 7 July 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of a teacher union gathered outside the Ministry of work to protest against the passing of a new law which would reduce their access to days off for health reasons.

On 8 July 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, a group of 25 people affected by the COSAVI fraud case demonstrated with banners to request the return of their money. The demonstrators tried to access a press conference held by fiscal authorities but were kept outside the press room.

On 12 July 2024, in San Salvador department, members of the police forces carried out 27 arrests of suspected Barrio 18 (Revolucionarios) members, who are accused of drug trafficking. The arrests took place in the municipalities of Ilopango, Soyapango, San Marcos, La Cima and the port area of La Libertad in San Salvador department.

On 14 July 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, protesters gathered in the historical centre to protest against Israel's attacks on Palestine, and demand freedom and justice for the Palestinian people.

assoc_actor_1: Former Police Forces of El Salvador (2019-); MTP: National Police Worker's Movement; Police Forces of El Salvador (2019-)
notes: On 16 July 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of the National Police Worker's Movement (MTP) and former members of the police force protested in front of the US embassy, claiming that they had been not compensated after being made redundant. The Police forces union issued a statement in support.

assoc_actor_1: MOVIR: Movement of Victims of the Regime; UNIDEHC: Unit for the Defense of Human And Communal Rights
notes: On 16 July 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, relatives of people detained under the state of exception and members of the MOVIR and UNIDECH movements marched towards the palace of the Supreme Court to demand a dialogue with the authorities and present evidence in support of their convicted relatives.

On 19 July 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, representatives of the country's tailors gathered in the Divino Salvador square to request a meeting with the authorities, after the head of the prison system claimed that inmates would not make schoolchildren's uniforms. The tailors demanded and alternative and claimed that without the school-related contracts many jobs and livelihoods would be at risk. They also claimed that some of the payment for previous years had not been delivered.

On 30 July 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, students of the National University led a protest march around the University campus and into the city centre. The march aimed to commemorate the student massacre of 1975, while also demanding investments in the University and the payment of grants from the central government. Lastly, they demanded that the University safeguards the right to protest of its students.

On 31 July 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, Venezuelan nationals gathered in front of the United Nations' office to demand that they take action in the face of the re-election of Maduro during the latest elections in Venezuela that has increased the state of crisis in the country.

On 3 August 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, Venezuelan nationals protested to express their support to the candidate of the opposite party in Venezuela who they believe won the election, while asking that Maduro, who was officially re-elected according to the National Electoral Council, to step down.

Around 4 August 2024 (as reported), in Suchitoto, Cuscatlan, four members of the B-18 Gang lynched another member of the gang to death after luring him to a specific location. The gang member was missing since 3 August and his lynched body was found on 4 August. The perpetrators were arrested on 8 August 2024. 1 fatality.
On 4 August 2024, in Ichanquezo, Cuscatlan, MS-13 members killed a gang member. It is suspected that the victim was stoned to death in a settling of scores. 1 fatality.
On 10 August 2024, in Ahuachapan, Ahuachapan, a gang member was killed in a brawl inside a penitentiary. The motivation of the brawl is unknown. 1 fatality.

source: El Mundo (El Salvador); La Prensa Grafica
notes: Around 11 August 2024 (as reported), in San Salvador, San Salvador, at least two people killed a man and a woman who were a couple and buried their bodies in the couple's courtyard. The motivation behind the attack is unclear, but the police have arrested six people in connection to the killing on 26 August. According to neighbors, there were no signs of burglary or lock picking in the house. 2 fatalities.

source: Diario Co Latino; La Prensa Grafica
notes: On 13 August 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, people protested in front of the Superintendency of the Financial System to ask for the authorities' assistance in getting their savings from a cooperative that was foreclosed due to fraud. The foreclosing has caused the people affected to be unable to access their funds for important things, such as medical procedures and their overall financial situation. The authorities have announced that they will start making the payments based on people's amount of savings.

assoc_actor_1: MOVIR: Movement of Victims of the Regime
notes: On 16 August 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of the Movement of Victims of the Regime (MOVIR), including family members, gathered at the presidential house to demand the liberation of people who have been wrongfully detained. They presented the records of 90 detainees whose innocence they have verified. They also demanded the intervention of international entities and that they torture and killings stop.

On 16 August 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of the Green Rebellion Political Movement (REVERDES) and other environmental activists gathered on the Italia Square to voice their concern with ongoing environmental issues and demand the implementation of the national agenda for the protection of the environment.

assoc_actor_2: Former FMLN: Farabundo Marti National Liberation Front; Teachers (El Salvador)
source: Diario Co Latino; El Mundo (El Salvador); La Prensa Grafica
notes: On 23 August 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, the police arrested a teacher and former member of the Farabundo Marti National Liberation Front (FMNL), accusing him of belonging to a criminal organization. Critics to the regime claim that the arrest was arbitrary and due to the victim's work within education workers unions. While in prison, the teacher suffered beatings and physical assaults by the police guards. He was released in August 2025 and died on 19 September 2025, due to complications caused by the beatings and the lack of healthcare inside prison.
On 30 August 2024, in Zacatecoluca, La Paz, unidentified attackers stabbed and killed a man inside a maximum security prison. The man was one of the chiefs of the MS-13 gang. 1 fatality.

On 4 September 2024, in La Cangrejera, La Libertad, four suspected MS-13 members stabbed and killed a man. The motivation behind the attack remains unknown. The four attackers were arrested by the police. 1 fatality.

source: Diario 1; El Mundo (El Salvador); El Salvador.com
notes: On 12 September 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, two groups of about 20 students clashed with stones. The two groups of students belonged to rival schools, the Instituto Nacional Francisco Menendez (INFRAMEN) and the Instituto Nacional Tecnico Industrial (INTI), and they are accused of forming rival gangs called 'La Raza INFRAMEN' and 'La Raza INTI'. In the past, similar events between schools were associated to gang actions and recruitment. Four people were seriously injured and ten people were arrested. 4 injured.

assoc_actor_1: BRP: Popular Resistence Block; MOVIR: Movement of Victims of the Regime
notes: On 15 September 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, protesters belonging to the MOVIR movement and the BRP marched to protest against the ongoing state of emergency and the incarceration and disappearance of many civilians.

On 23 September 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of the COFOA, Faith Communities Organized in Action group (Catholic Christian Group) protested in front of the congress to demand the respect of the Constitution in the election process for senior judges.

assoc_actor_1: MOVIR: Movement of Victims of the Regime; UNIDEHC: Unit for the Defense of Human And Communal Rights
notes: On 24 September 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, civil society activists belonging to the MOVIR movement and the UNIDEHC organization organized a protest to demand the release of citizens 'unfairly' detained under the state of emergency. Dozens of relatives of people under custody arrived to meet with lawyers and brought documentation to ask for their release. A journalist present on the scene was verbally intimidated by a police officer, who demanded that she stopped filming and deleted any footage, before asking for the journalist's credentials and recording them. However, there was no physical confrontation reported.

On 26 September 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, students from the national University of El Salvador protested against the continued impunity of a former student leader who is accused of sexually harassing another student.

On 6 October 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, dozens of teachers and healthcare workers gathered to protest against budget cuts in their respective sectors, demanding that the government change its budget allocation.

On 7 October 2024, around Santa Maria Ostuma, La Paz, police officers clashed with gang members, of which at least one belonged to the Ms-13 gang, after finding them in the act of exchanging drugs in canton San Antonio. A gang member was fatally shot. Two other were arrested. 1 fatality.

On 13 October 2024, around Santa Ana, Santa Ana, according to witnesses, members of the B-18 gang kidnapped a man, killed him, and burnt his body. No motivation was stated for the attack, but the perpetrators were later arrested. 1 fatality.

Property destruction: On 17 October 2024, off the Coast of San Rafael Tasajera, La Paz, 1,704 kilometers from the Bocana Cordoncillo, members of the Salvadorean navy seized a boat with more than 1.5 tons of cocaine on board. They also arrested an undisclosed number of Ecuadorean men on board the boat, and three Mexican citizens on another boat which was operating jointly with the first one.

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (El Salvador); SITRASALUD: Health Workers Union
notes: On 19 October 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of a variety of unions of healthcare workers, including the SITRASALUD, participated in a protest march to complain against the recent reforms of the health and education service, including the freeze of the pay for doctors and teachers and other cuts. The teachers unions were supposed to participate in the march, but hours before they announced they had reached an agreement with the government to hold talks.

assoc_actor_1: Catholic Christian Group (El Salvador); Health Workers (El Salvador); Vamos: Let's Go El Salvador Party
notes: On 23 October 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of COFOA- Communities of Faith in Action (Catholic group) accompanied by the Medical Association and the Union of Doctors and Workers of the Salvadoran Social Security Institute (Simetrisss), gathered to present their demands to the Minister of Health, demanding better budgetary allocations and the construction of a hospital in Acajutla. They were not received by the Minister. A deputy of the VAMOS party also participated in the demonstration.

On 24 October 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of an environmental organization held a protest in front of the agriculture ministry, complaining about the cutting of trees in the Santa Adelaida area. They claimed that the cutting was in violation of Salvadorean law, that it would affect the local inhabitants negatively, and that it was related to bitcoin mining.

assoc_actor_1: Bloque de Busqueda de Personas Desaparecidas
notes: On 25 October 2024, in Antiguo Cuscatlan, La Libertad, family members of a disappeared person gathered in front of the local district attorney's office to demand an investigation into the disappearance. They were accompanied by members of the Bloque de Busqueda de Personas Desaparecidas and other human rights organizations.

assoc_actor_1: FESITRAMES: Federation of Unions of Municipal Workers of El Salvador; Labor Group (El Salvador)
notes: On 27 October 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, workers belonging to the Federation of Unions of Municipal Workers protested in front of the city's cathedral to demand respect of labour rights and a dialogue with the city's mayor, while lamenting unjust termination of contracts and poor working conditions.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of El Salvador (2019-); Police Forces of El Salvador (2019-)
notes: Security measures: On 28 October 2024, in San Marcos, San Salvador, President Bukele has announced the deployment of over 2000 soldiers and 500 police officers in the Colonia 10 de Octubre, as the authorities suspect the area to be a gang hideout. The security forces established checkpoints and are patrolling the streets.

assoc_actor_1: MOVIR: Movement of Victims of the Regime; UNIDEHC: Unit for the Defense of Human And Communal Rights
notes: On 28 October 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of the Unit for the Defense of Human Rights and of the MOVIR movement gathered at the Attorney General's office to protests against the fact that many public defendants assigned to cases covered by the State of Exception in the country have not followed due process, for instance by not requesting criminal records about their defendants. The protesters claim that this undermines the rule of law and the rights of the accused.

On 31 October 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of the Popular Resistance Bloc marched towards the legislative assembly to protest against the proposal for the 2025 budget, claiming it would increase poverty rates and negatively affect the country.

assoc_actor_1: FUSS: Unitary Federation of Unions of El Salvador; Labor Group (El Salvador)
notes: On 31 October 2024, In San Salvador, San Salvador, members of the FUSS union federation gathered in a cemetery to remember the massacre of union leaders that took place on 31 October 1989, and rejected the government actions against unionized workers and leaders who participated in the protest of 19 October 2024 against the freeze of resources for the Education and Health sectors (coded separately). They also voiced their discontent with the budget, and with the state of exception

On 31 October 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of an association of leaders street merchants marched to the legislative assembly to deliver a proposal that would allow them to remain in activity until the beginning of the new calendar year. Under the current legislation, they are expected to cease their business activities in the streets of San Salvador on 1 November.

source: Diario Co Latino; La Prensa Grafica
notes: On 1 November 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of various associations related to the Salvadorean Civil War gathered in the Cuscatlan Park to commemorate the victims and the disappeared, and to demand that the legislative assembly approve the new draft for a law on transitional justice, memory and reconciliation.

assoc_actor_1: MOVIR: Movement of Victims of the Regime; COFAPPES: Committee of Relatives of Political Prisoners of El Salvador
source: Diario Co Latino; La Prensa Grafica
notes: On 5 November 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, relatives of people imprisoned under the state of exception, as well as members of the MOVIR and the COFAPPES movements, marched towards the legislative assembly to deliver a letter affirming their rights to visit the inmates and to have some information regarding them and their situation.

On 5 November 2024, in Jiquilisco, Usulutan, more than 60 local residents marched to protest against the local mayor (from the Nuevas Ideas party) and ask for her removal. They complained about her arbitrary actions, such as the unfair dismissal of another elected official.

On 9 November 2024, in Santa Tecla, La Libertad, a member of the MS-13 gang hit repeatedly another man outside a restaurant for no apparent reason. The gang member was later arrested. No further details reported. 1 injured.

On 9 November 2024, in Zacatecoluca, La Paz, police officers stopped a member of the Villa Mariona Locos Salvatruchos clica. The man wrestled with and stole a gun from one of the officers and attempted to flee, but the police caught him in colonia Los Almendros 2, where they opened fire against him, injuring him. He was then arrested. 1 injured.

assoc_actor_1: COFAPPES: Committee of Relatives of Political Prisoners of El Salvador
notes: On 10 November 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, members of the COFAPPES civil society group gathered to protest against 'the arbitrary nature of many arrests', claiming that the attorney's office is using its powers to prosecute individuals for political purposes.

On 12 November 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, 30 members of a labor association of shoeshines gathered in front of the National Assembly to protest against their eviction from the city centre, and the unresponsiveness of city authorities. They claim that the space to which they have been forced to relocate is not conductive to their business.

On 14 November 2024, in Cojutepeque, Cuscatlan, members of the ADES civil society organization and the Santa Marta community gathered outside the local attorney's office to protests against the continued judicial investigations into the Santa Marta community leaders, who have been accused of committing crimes during the Salvadorean Civil War. The protesters claim the charges are politically motivated.

assoc_actor_1: UNIDEHC: Unit for the Defense of Human And Communal Rights
notes: On 20 November 2024, in San Salvador, San Salvador, protesters affected by the fraud case of COSAVI, assisted by lawyers from the UNIDECH association, gathered in front of the offices of the National Commission for Human Rights and Freedom of Expression to protest against the lack of attention to their case from the authorities and to demand a dialogue. They claimed the police and the attorneys have been slow in responding and not transparent.
